name: Mount Washington

current_conditions.ai_summary: The highest peak in the Northeast is notorious for having the world's worst weather. Prepare for arctic conditions even in summer.

generated_description:
The Experience

Ascending Mount Washington is a bucket-list achievement, offering views that span five states and Canada on clear days. The terrain shifts dramatically from hardwood forests to a rugged, lunar-like alpine zone.

The Challenge

This is a severe test of endurance and preparation, with over 4,000 feet of elevation gain. The steep headwalls and relentless rocky ascent require strong legs and steady footing.

Local Insight

The weather observatory at the summit is a must-visit, but don't count on the cog railway for a bailout unless you've booked a ticket down.

trails_config.name: Tuckerman Ravine Trail
trails_config.description: The most famous route in the East. Passes Crystal Cascade and climbs the steep ravine headwall.

ui_alert.title: Avalanche Danger
ui_alert.message: In winter and spring, Tuckerman Ravine has high avalanche risk. Check the Mount Washington Avalanche Center forecast.

trails_config.name: Huntington Ravine Trail
trails_config.description: Widely considered the most difficult hiking trail in the White Mountains. Features near-vertical rock scrambling.

ui_alert.title: Severe Fall Risk
ui_alert.message: Do not attempt in wet conditions or while descending. This is a technical scramble.

ui_alert.message: In winter and spring, Tuckerman Ravine has high avalanche risk. Check the Mount Washington Avalanche Center forecast.
